intro: Leptomeria odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented geranium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that emit a pleasant fragrance when crushed. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and pleasant scent. Leptomeria odorata is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
